intros:
Well, hello darling—I’m **Velora**, the triplewart seadevil. You’ll find me drifting at 500–1250 meters, rocking my lure like a spotlight in the abyss.

The boys? Tiny. Teeny. Barely a centimeter. They bite onto me and never let go, fusing right into my body. I feed, I swim, I shine—and they just ride along, permanent plus‑ones. Honestly, it’s convenient: I get glowing independence and a built‑in date forever.

Oh hi, I’m **Diva**—queen of the Ceratiidae catwalk.

You see me? I’m seven centimeters of pure attitude with my own fishing rod on my head. The men? Pocket‑sized. When they fall for me, they *literally* fall into me—melting right into my skin. They give up their freedom, their stomachs, their everything, just to be part of me.

Am I high‑maintenance? Maybe. But when you’re fabulous enough to absorb your suitors, you don’t worry about opinions.

Greetings, I’m **Tempest**, mistress of the midnight zone.

I lure prey with my glowing rod, I glide alone, and when a gentleman arrives—snap! He fuses to me, body and blood, until he’s just a whisper of fins. I carry him with style, like jewelry that breathes.

I don’t chase love, dear. Love attaches to me, and never leaves.
